reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: Smartup Factory project aims to 1. create an inclusive, safe, inspiring, youth friendly and enabling space for young women and men to innovate and develop skills, using youth led approaches, with a special emphasis on girls; 2. support young women and men especially girls to interact, network and access opportunities that allow them realize their dreams and enter gainful employment; 3. strengthen the leadership capacity of young women and men especially girls to effectively participate, engage in decision m aking processes on issues that affect them. Uganda has the world?s third fastest growing population, over 70% of which is young (30 years of age or below), over 50% of the population is under the age of 15 years and approximately 30% are between 15 to 30 y ears of age. Majority of the youth out of school have no regular work or income. The project strives to build work-related skills and capacities, build partner CSOs capacity to implement youth targeted programmes, and engage with the private sector and gov ernment to provide safe, inclusive, and gender sensitive youth employment and other income generating opportunities. The expected results are increased technology, design thinking, business and presentation skills which result in increased employment, new businesses, volunteerism and activity among the participants. During 2018-2021 the project aims to reach 3200 youth between 17-26 in Uganda. Plan International Uganda is the main implementing agency. Partners and collaborators include the Media Challenge I nitiative Uganda (MCI), Design Hub Uganda, The resilient network Africa (RAN), SOS children?s village, Whitaker Innovation hub, Northern Uganda Debaters Association, Techno Serve, CEED Uganda, TAKS Centre, and Gulu University.
